Tips.Underlined: Create a shortcut to access your settings.json file in VSCode
Tips.Tip: This will allow you to easily make changes to the file, without having to find it using a lengthy process. Scroll down(codeBlockRef) to see instructions on making a shortcut.
Having a search functionality will make finding things much easier and faster, and provide an overall better user experience.
Personal projects are a great thing to have on your resume and can help your practice and improve your skills.

Readability and formatting is an important part of creating good code. It makes it much easier to tell what's going on and read code when it's properly formatted. Scroll down(codeBlockTwoRef) to see examples in Python and Java.
Using things like git version control, organizing your code into classes and components, documentation, testing, etc. can all help improve the quality of your code and software.

This is when you program with someone else. We do this all the time at IBM and USAA. Coding with someone else is a great way to learn new things, catch mistakes, and overall improve the quality of your code.
If you see blocks of code frequently repeating, there's probably a better way to write it. The use of for loops, classes, components, etc. are great ways to have reusable and cleaner code.

Tips.Underlined: If it feels weird, it probably is
Tips.Tip: If something you're doing feels weird and forced, there's probably a better way do it. Run your code through ChatGpt or another person to see if there are other ways you could potentially write it.
This is a really good package manager for MacOS that be used used to download libraries and stuff. Scroll down(codeBlockThreeRef) to see the instructions on how to download it.

Learning the names of certain operators, functions, etc. will help when you're trying to explain code. For example, things like knowing what a ternary operator is called. It also help you better understand code when someone else is explaining.

When creating a UI, try not to overload a single page with too much information. Also when you're coding don't make your files excessively long. Break it into classes, components, other files, etc. Try to keep them relatively short, organized, and simple.
Obviously you're free to do whatever you want, but using dark mode in a text editor typically improves code highlighting and readability. It also won't burn your eyes at night.
VSCode is an extremely useful text editor with a lot cool features and can be used for basically any language or purpose.

Tips.Underlined: Use Python when working with Excel
Tips.Tip: Obviously you can't use Python to help with all Excel tasks, but I'd definitely look into using Python with Excel.

Debug mode is a great way see the values of the variables you're working with and other helpful information. I feel like debug is particularly useful in CSC 231 and definitely something worth learning.
If all you're data is static, you can use a JSON file instead of setting up a database. That's what I did for this website. Also, if you're websites static you can host it on GitHub pages for free.

I met a lot of people at UNCW who were biased against basically any language that wasn't Python. Don't be afraid to try out new languages and know that different syntax really isn't that hard to learn. I personally really like certain aspects of Java.
A great way to get good anything is to practice it frequently. Programming is no different.
This is kind of building on point 17, just try new things and see what you like when programming.

Tips.Underlined: Learn how to exit a nano file
Tips.Tip: When you're editing a file using the nano command press control + o to save, then press enter to write the changes. Then control + x to exit
It's a great a tool for helping you while you're programming. However, I'd strongly recommend trying to learn and understand the code it generates.
A framework will make creating a web application much easier. I'd recommend Vue.js (with the Composition API) because it's very beginner friendly. I used Vue.js to create this website.
Having a SWE internship during college will definitely help you when searching for a fulltime job.

Tips.Underlined: Have a basic understanding of regex
Tips.Tip: You learn about Regex in CSC 360. It can be a very useful tool and something worth checking out.
They can be a great way to practice your skills and prepare for coding interviews.

ComponentData.Name: Create a Shortcut to Access VSCode Setting.json
ComponentData.Description: Open Visual Studio Code, then press "command + shift + p". Then, in the dialogue box type "Open Keyboard Shortcuts (JSON)". Click on the matching result. Copy and paste the json below into the file then save it. Now the shortcut "Command + option + =" should open settings.json

ComponentData.Name: Properly Formatted Java file
ComponentData.Description: This is a properly formatted Java file. Note the use of whitespace around the if-else and for-loop blocks. Also note the comments. Learn more here -> https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html.
